column4: I cant get to anything on /  only the stuff from busybox.  if I try mount -a it says that cannot read /etc/fstab.  Also, I am on 9.10/dell E6500 and I do have my user dir encrypted
u need a entry in /etc/fstab for mount -a to work
I assure you there was one there last night when I went to bed and shutdown
creating fstab entry is not all that difficult, google it up
if it will just mount the root device, it would see all of that
i didnt change any of that
Leave worrying about the previous setup, just create a new entry in fstab and enjoy
I cant get to fstab or I would do that
you mean to say there is no fstab inside etc ??
I am not seeing the same / as I usually see either  I have a /software that is not there either
I think I may be in a ramdisk busybox shell or something
I am sure of busybx, i thought you are working with ubuntu
apparently, if ubuntu fails at boot, it drops into busybox shell
I think you are taking about bash shell prompt. What is that about busybox.
